content.description:
The obvious line located on climbers left of the falls. The farther left one goes, the easier the movement. Short but sweet.

Standard Ice rack.

Take your pick of lines on the left. Can be climbed as a short WI4-5, or continue beyond the ice into a sketchy M4-5. The mixed section is virtually unprotectable on lead due to the rock in the area (loose, disintegrating sandstone) so only recommended on TR. Belayers should set up well clear on the debris field.

TR can be set up by walking around and following the goat path up and around on climbers right of the falls.
Standard rack for the ice. TR for the mixed.

As the name suggests, climb the line(s) up the middle of the falls. Wide enough for multiple parties, this is a nice bit of vertical Ice

Standard Ice Rack

pathTokens: CENTRAL ONTARIO; Toronto Region and West of Hwy 11 to Sault Ste Marie; Bracebridge, Sudbury

content.description:
Probably the closest, most accessible ice in the GTA. Can be SUPER busy on weekends, as a lot of guiding companies take intro classes there (which in turn can lead to hacked out conditions). Great variety of routes from WI2 on climbers left, all the way to some sketchy mixed WI4/M4 stuff on climbers right. 
  
 Conditions are really hit and miss, due to proximity to urban areas. Some years it won't come in at all. 
  
 All in all, a great place for bouldering or a quick few hours on ice without a huge travel commitment.
